description: blonde woman with large, wide eyes and round face seated on a donkey; woman wears a white blouse and apron, yellow vest, long blue skirt, red shoes, red headband and white neckerchief trimmed in red; brown donkey wearing a harness
provenance: Lusieri's heirs (until 1824; sold to Elgin); Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin, Broomhall (1824-d.1841); by descent to Andrew, Lord Bruce, later 11th Earl of Elgin (until 1965; sale, Christie's, London, July 6, 1965, part of no. 104; [Colnaghi, London, until 1971; sold for $369, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1971-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Woman on a Donkey (Lady Bessborough or Lady Spencer?)
